extendedIngredients.name: ears corn
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 ears fresh corn, husks and silks removed

extendedIngredients.name: new potatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 pounds baby red or new potatoes, cut into 1/2 to 1-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: poblano chiles
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 poblano chiles, charred, peeled, stemmed, seeded, and chopped (see Cook's Note)

extendedIngredients.name: salt and pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: scallions
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup chopped scallions (white and pale green parts only)

recipes.title: Poblano Potato Salad
recipes.instructions: Watch how to make this recipe.                    Put the potatoes in a large pot and add salted water to cover. Bring to a boil over medium heat and cook until tender when pierced with a knife, about 20 to 30 minutes. Drain the potatoes and let cool slightly.                          Meanwhile, preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat. Add the corn to the grill and cook, turning occasionally, until evenly browned on all sides, about 10 minutes.                          Put the potatoes in a large serving bowl. Using a sharp knife, carefully cut the kernels off the cobs and add them to the bowl. Add the poblano chiles, scallions, sour cream, mayonnaise, and cilantro, and fold together. Season the potato salad, to taste, with salt and pepper and serve.

steps.step: Watch how to make this recipe.
Put the potatoes in a large pot and add salted water to cover. Bring to a boil over medium heat and cook until tender when pierced with a knife, about 20 to 30 minutes.
Drain the potatoes and let cool slightly.
Meanwhile, preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Add the corn to the grill and cook, turning occasionally, until evenly browned on all sides, about 10 minutes.
Put the potatoes in a large serving bowl. Using a sharp knife, carefully cut the kernels off the cobs and add them to the bowl.
Add the poblano chiles, scallions, sour cream, mayonnaise, and cilantro, and fold together. Season the potato salad, to taste, with salt and pepper and serve.
